title: I invested in Monzo. Here's why I'm not worried about competition from Revolut
text:
Has Monzo, the once infallible start-up bank, lost its neon sparkle? Like rivals Revolut and Starling, it is still struggling to turn its immense popularity into any reasonable form of revenue or profit.

Its expansion plans are expensive and the newer banks seem to be cannibalising each other rather than focusing on taking customers from the established high street brands.

Then there's the latest mess up at Monzo. It irked its loyal customers by closing down a paid-for premium service that offered discounts and insurance, bungling how it communicated this and mis-handling refunds.

Many will now be wondering whether the bank is losing – or has already lost – the sheen that justified the £2bn valuation...
